items.title: AMC Announces a Third Anne Rice Series in the Immortal Universe
items.description: AMC has announced that it will be starting production on a third, currently unnamed full-length television series in its \u201cAnne Rice\u2019s Immortal Universe,\u201d ahead of the airing of the second seasons of the two current series: Interview With the Vampire and Mayfair Witches. This third series will focus on the Talamasca,\u2026Read more...

items.title: BREAK!! Into the Gaming Shelf With an Homage to Classic JRPGs
items.description: There are so many incredible crowdfunding campaigns going on, I really can\u2019t stand it. Games are so good, y\u2019all. I\u2019ve also got some new games, supplements and additions, and indie designers who are taking it upon themselves to break apart systems and find new, incredible, and transformative ways to play games. (Every \u2026Read more...

items.title: RIP Red Envelope: After 25 Years, Netflix is Killing Its DVD Rentals
items.description: After some 25 years, Netflix is officially retiring its DVD rental service. The company announced the move in a tweet Tuesday, explaining that its final discs will ship on Sept. 29th: Read more...

items.title: Reddit Will Start Charging Big Companies for API Access
items.description: Reddit execs have noticed that everyone is getting rich off of AI but them. The company announced on Tuesday that it will start charging businesses for using its application programming interface (API) which allows users to download and process data from person-to-person conversations.  as it plans to go public on\u2026Read more...

items.title: Musk's Twitter Decides Misgendering and Deadnaming Are OK, Actually
items.description: As Twitter under Elon Musk\u2019s rule continues to take shape, the platform has decided it apparently doesn\u2019t need trans people to feel safe on its app. Twitter has reportedly removed a stipulation against misgendering and deadnaming from its policy on hateful conduct.Read more...

items.title: Watch Live as Russian Cosmonauts Relocate a Radiator Outside the ISS
items.description: Two cosmonauts are getting ready to venture outside the International Space Station (ISS) on Tuesday night for some orbital maintenance work. Read more...

items.title: Deadpool 3's Wolverine Is, Somehow, Completely New
items.description: Hugh Jackman\u2019s Wolverine is returning to the big screen next year, but according to Deadpool himself, it won\u2019t be the character fans know and love. Read more...

items.title: Google's Pixel Fold Will Make its Debut in Just Two Months
items.description: This may very well be the year of the foldable smartphone, or at least the year of more foldable choices. According to CNBC, Google plans to launch its first foldable smartphone before the next Pixel 8 flagship release. We could see the Pixel Fold, which previously seemed to have been canceled and vaguely revived, as\u2026Read more...

items.title: Amazon Prime Video Introduces AI-Boosted Dialogue to Select Original Content
items.description: Amazon Prime Video announced a new Dialogue Boost feature on Tuesday that will allow viewers to turn up the volume for character dialogue in some movies and TV shows. The feature was originally pitched as a way to assist hard-of-hearing viewers by increasing the actors\u2019 voices and toning down the background noise, but\u2026Read more...

items.title: We Finally Know Something About Agatha: Coven of Chaos
items.description: Sure, we knew Katharyn Hahn would be returning to play her breakout character in the upcoming WandaVision spin-off Agatha: Coven of Chaos. We knew who had joined her for the show, including Patti LuPone, Aubrey Plaza, and Heartstopper\u2019s Joe Locke. But until today, we didn\u2019t know about its plot or characters, and it\u2019s\u2026Read more...

items.title: Fox News and Dominion Settle Defamation Dispute for $787.5 Million
items.description: Dominion Voting Systems and Fox News have reached a settlement in the companies\u2019 two-year-long defamation dispute. The agreement was announced by the case\u2019s presiding judge in court on Tuesday afternoon, according to multiple reports\u2014coming just hours after jury selection was completed. The decision by both parties to\u2026Read more...

items.title: Scientists Are About to Try to Create Stem Cells in Space
items.description: Stem cell research is expanding beyond earthly confines. Scientists from Cedars-Sinai in California have partnered with the private company Axiom Space to help them produce stem cells aboard the International Space Station\u2014an apparent first that will test whether these cells can be manufactured more efficiently in a\u2026Read more...

items.title: Instagram Finally Lets You Post Multiple In-Bio Links
items.description: Instagram has caved to years of creator demands. The social platform will now let users include links to multiple external sites directly in their in-app profiles, as reported by multiple outlets and confirmed by Gizmodo.Read more...

items.title: Sorry, Renfield—Vampire's Kiss Is Still Nic Cage's Greatest Vampire Movie
items.description: Renfield might be the first movie where Nicolas Cage plays Dracula, but it\u2019s not the first movie where he\u2019s played a vampire. Kind of. Maybe? That indistinct honor goes to 1988\u2019s Vampire\u2019s Kiss, an exceedingly strange movie where Cage becomes a vampire... sort of. He does have to buy a pair of fake Halloween fangs to\u2026Read more...

items.title: Mini V8 Engine Turns Normal Electric Drill Into Nitro-Thirsty Monster
items.description: There are many advantages to using electric motors in tools, including high-levels of torque, lightweight designs, and relatively quiet operation. But if you miss the deafening roar of a gas-powered engine, it turns out you can upgrade a battery-powered drill with a tiny V8 engine and make it sound like you\u2019re\u2026Read more...

items.title: Hey '90s Kids: Disney Channel Is 40 Years Old Today
items.description: In its continued quest to capture the attention of families across America, media juggernaut Disney developed its namesake television channel, with the network\u2019s first broadcast going live on April 18, 1983\u2014exactly 40 years ago, today. Four decades later, it\u2019s impossible to understate just how much of an impact the\u2026Read more...

items.title: Microsoft Reportedly Pinning its AI Hopes on In-House ‘Athena’ Chip
items.description: Microsoft has a lot riding on AI, so much that it\u2019s reportedly developing its own superpowered chip designed specifically for training and running its sophisticated chatbot systems. This chip, code-named \u201cAthena,\u201d would need Olympus-sized power to channel all of Microsoft\u2019s ambitions in the AI arena.Read more...

items.title: Desperate to Launch: Europe Looks to SpaceX as Rocket Woes Continue
items.description: Europe\u2019s navigation satellites are in desperate need of a ride to space, so much so that the European government is seeking to forge deals with U.S. companies to provide much-needed orbital access. Read more...

items.title: Dead Ringers' Power Couple on the Show's Uniquely Unsettling Thrills
items.description: Created by Alice Birch and starring Rachel Weisz (twice), Prime Video\u2019s Dead Ringers evolves David Cronenberg\u2019s 1988 squirm-inducing classic about twins whose obsession with each other becomes their downfall. Ahead of the six-episode series\u2019 release on April 21, io9 spoke with two of Dead Ringers\u2019 key co-stars, whose\u2026Read more...

items.title: Life Is Finding a Way on the Great Pacific Garbage Patch
items.description: Unexpected marine animals are thriving on the massive amounts of plastic waste that has accumulated at sea. In a new study published in the journal Nature Ecology & Evolution, researchers describe how creatures that are normally found along coastlines, not the open ocean, have made their homes on floating trash in the\u2026Read more...

items.title: How an American Logging Giant Bills Itself as a Climate Hero
items.description: One of the largest timber companies in the world is claiming to \u201ccontribute to climate change solutions,\u201d despite the fact that it\u2019s planning to increase lumber production over the next couple of years. As the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday, logging giant Weyerhaeuser has made a pivot in recent years to\u2026Read more...

items.title: James Gunn Celebrates Superman’s Anniversary in the Best Possible Way
items.description: The next Superman movie, Superman: Legacy, is heading to theaters in just over two years and today, its writer and director announced he\u2019s full steam ahead. James Gunn, the co-president of DC Films, is that person and he took to social media on Tuesday to reveal that he\u2019s diving \u201cfully into early pre-production\u201d on\u2026Read more...

items.title: The Galaxy Quest TV Series Inches Toward Becoming Reality
items.description: \u201cNever give up, never surrender!\u201d The quotable motto from  1999 cult-beloved sci-fi comedy Galaxy Quest truly encapsulates the journey of the Galaxy Quest television series, as Variety reports Paramount+ now\xa0has the\xa0long-awaited project in \u201cearly development.\u201dRead more...

items.title: Back to the Mines: Iowa Senate Moves to Legalize Child Labor in Pre-Dawn Session
items.description: As companies like Uber transition the world onto the gig economy, and AI promises to eliminate the need for large swaths of the workforce, the great state of Iowa is taking a stand, declaring once and for all that child labor is good, actually.Read more...

items.title: 6 Mammal Body Parts That Look Like They Were Stolen From Other Animals
items.description: Mammals have a pretty basic blueprint. Among other things, we give birth to live young, we\u2019re warm-blooded, and, perhaps most obviously, we all have hair. (Yes, even dolphins.) But in the churn of natural selection, some mammals ended up with appendages that  look like they should be found on a reptile, bird, or\u2026Read more...

items.title: Alaska Airlines Kills the Check-in Kiosk, Brings in Face Scanners
items.description: Alaska Airlines is flying forward into the future. Or, trying to do something like that at least. The company announced a suite of changes, soon to be coming to airport lobbies, in a Tuesday press release. Read more...

items.title: Southwest Airlines Says 'Firewall Failure' Temporarily Grounded Planes
items.description: The flying punching bag that is Southwest Airlines once again had to temporarily cancel flights due to computer issues. Mid-morning on Tuesday ET, Southwest said it halted operations at some airports due to \u201cintermittent technology issues.\u201d The company wrote on Twitter that it was working to get things operational\u2026Read more...

items.title: SpaceX Targets 4/20 for Second Starship Launch Attempt
items.description: On Monday, a pesky valve is all that came between SpaceX and the maiden flight of its Starship megarocket. The company is now targeting Thursday morning for a mission that CEO Elon Musk predicts has a 50/50 chance of succeeding.Read more...

items.title: NSO Group Targeted Apple's FindMy and Homekit Features With New Zero-Click Exploits
items.description: Israeli digital surveillance for hire giant NSO Group reportedly deployed at least three new attacks last year targeting human rights workers and other members of civil society spread out around the world using Apple devices. All of those \u201czero-click\u201d exploits, according to new research from The Citizen Lab, could\u2026Read more...

items.title: Google and Apple Are Reportedly Miffed About All the Porn on Amazon Kindle
items.description: Rule 34 rears its head once again. There are thousands upon thousands of explicit porn being sold for cheap on Amazon\u2019s Kindle. On Tuesday, Reuters reported that both Apple and Google have notified Amazon about its failure to keep porn off of the Kindle store and app. Both companies told Reuters that their app stores\u2026Read more...

items.title: Defunct NASA Satellite Expected to Fall to Earth in Days
items.description: A retired NASA spacecraft is about to meet its fiery demise, burning up in Earth\u2019s atmosphere after its expected free-fall from orbit later this week. Read more...

items.title: Critical Role's Vex and Vax Get a Dynamic Sculpture From Dark Horse Direct
items.description: Vex\u2019ahlia and Vax\u2019ildan, two of the adventuring party of Vox Machina, are coming to life in a nearly eight-inch tall statue\u2014well, the top half of them, anyway. A collaboration between Dark Horse Direct and Critical Role, this joint bust features character designs based on the comic book series Vox Machina Origins.\u2026Read more...

items.title: Prehistoric Planet Season 2 Trailer Shows Off Fresh CGI Dinosaurs
items.description: Prehistoric Planet showcases dinosaurs as the itchy, curious, clumsy, and vocal animals they were in life. Apple TV+ today released the teaser trailer for the scientific dinosaur show\u2019s second season, which is set to debut on May 22.Read more...

items.title: You Can Finally Buy Homer Simpson's Assassins Sneakers
items.description: Now that Nike has already figured out how to make the futuristic self-lacing shoes from Back to the Future II a reality, it\u2019s time for sneakerheads to focus their attention on another pair of kicks that, until today, only ever existed in pop culture. The Assassins sneakers, featured in season two of the The Simpsons, \u2026Read more...

items.title: Mrs. Davis Is a Show That's So Far Out There, It's Almost Too Much
items.description: Whatever you expect from Mrs. Davis, the new show coming to Peacock on April 20, you\u2019re probably mistaken. The series description will tell you it\u2019s about a nun, played by Glow\u2019s Betty Gilpin, who sets out to take down an artificial intelligence called Mrs. Davis, which has become a pseudo-replacement for God in a\u2026Read more...

items.title: WhatsApp and Signal Threaten to End Service in UK if 'Online Safety Bill' Passed
items.description: Meta\u2019s WhatsApp is threatening to leave the UK if the government passes the Online Safety Bill, saying it will essentially eliminate its encryption methods. Alongside its rival company Signal and five other apps, the company said that, by passing the bill, users will no longer be protected  by end-to-end encryption,\u2026Read more...

items.title: Michelle Yeoh's Star Trek Show Is Finally Happening as a Movie
items.description: The Yeohnaissance continues! Fresh off her Academy Award win for Everything Everywhere All at Once, the incomparable Michelle Yeoh will return to the Star Trek universe to play Philippa Georgiou once again. But instead of the Section 31 TV series that has been in the works since 2019 or so, Yeoh will now star in Star\u2026Read more...

items.description: Tax day is April 18th\u2014today. We shouldn\u2019t have to be here, but here we are. Sure, you can labor through the labyrinthine official tax forms and send those to the U.S. government yourself. But as is the case every year in the U.S., the best options for less stress when filing taxes online for free are also the same\u2026Read more...

items.title: Researchers Find Secondhand Routers Dripping With Corporate Secrets
items.description: Let this be a lesson in wiping your hardware before sending it out to a refurbisher: Researchers from the security firm ESET have found that less then half of secondhand enterprise routers in their sample were wiped of internal data, which poses a risk both for the companies that sold these routers and their customers.Read more...

items.title: NASA Turned Its Giant Swimming Pool Into the Moon for Artemis Astronauts
items.description: Teams at an underwater facility in Houston, Texas, are making preparations to train astronauts who are preparing for future missions to the Moon. This facility is being modified to recreate the harsh lunar environment by submerging future moonwalkers in a pool that\u2019s 40 feet deep.Read more...

items.title: Star Trek Release Dates: When to Expect All the New and Returning Shows
items.description: Trying to keep track of what\u2019s coming in the realm of Star Trek\xa0feels like trying to stop a tribble from procreating.  Before even more new series are announced, here\u2019s our guide of when to expect all the new Star Trek shows, as well as returning familiar favorites, and what else is in the works right now. Engage!Read more...

items.title: Elon Musk Tells Tucker Carlson He’s Creating a ChatGPT Rival Called TruthGPT
items.description: Twitter CEO Elon Musk told Fox News host Tucker Carlson that he was working on a rival to OpenAI\u2019s ChatGPT, a company he co-founded in 2015, called \u201cTruthGPT.\u201d According to Musk, his chatbot will be a \u201cmaximum truth-seeking AI\u201d that will try to understand the nature of the universe. Read more...

items.title: DC Release Dates: When to See DCEU Movies and HBO Max Shows
items.description: The DC Extended Universe is finally giving Marvel a run for its money\u2014something that\u2019s bound to increase now that James Gunn is running the show. The DCEU\u2019s myriad projects stretch far beyond  superhero mainstays Batman, Superman, and the Justice League, promising to include new and interesting takes on DC Comics\u2019\u2026Read more...

items.title: Everything We Know About the Future of Doctor Who
items.description: Doctor Who ended the eras of both Chris Chibnall as series showrunner and Jodie Whittaker as the 13th Doctor in 2022 with \u201cThe Power of the Doctor,\u201d bringing to a close a three-season, three-special run.Read more...

items.title: Google Experiment Reassures Ad Tech Bros That They’ll Be Just Fine After Chrome's Cookies Are Gone
items.description: In 2024, Google will block third-party cookies in Chrome, the world\u2019s most widely used internet browser. That will kill off one of the main ways companies track you online, and the ad tech industry is freaking out about it. Google has developed a suite of tools to replace cookies, which it collectively calls \u201cPrivacy\u2026Read more...

items.title: Adobe's Finally Looking Out for Dads With Lightroom Updates That Can Automatically Darken Graying Beards
items.description: Portrait photographers can spend hours perfecting a single headshot in Adobe\u2019s apps\u2014everything from erasing skin imperfections to making the subject look much younger than they really are. Some of those advanced photo-retouching techniques just got a lot easier, as today Adobe announced several AI-powered Lightroom\u2026Read more...

items.title: Elon Musk's Twitter Tweaks Nuked These 13 Useful Emergency Service Bots
items.description: Automated emergency and essential service Twitter accounts have become the latest casualty in Elon Musk\u2019s flailing effort to rid Twitter of bots and squeeze users to pay for previously free access to its application programming interface (API).Read more...

items.title: Withings' Body Smart Scale Includes an 'Eyes Closed Mode' That Hides Your Weight
items.description: Modern smart scales can measure more than just a user\u2019s weight; they also capture other useful health metrics, which is good motivation to use them frequently. But for those mornings when you would rather not know how you\u2019re weighing in, Withings\u2019 new Body Smart scale will still take those measurements, but hide them\u2026Read more...
